fun_facts.fact: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
It takes a photon up to 40,000 years to travel from the Sun's core to its surface, but only 8 minutes to travel the rest of the way to Earth.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the invention of the iPhone than to the building of the Great Pyramid of Giza.
A snail can sleep for three years.
The original name for the search engine Google was 'Backrub'.
The total length of all the blood vessels in the human body is over 60,000 miles.
Cranberries are bounced to determine their freshness; a good one will bounce 4 inches high.
There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way galaxy.
The tongue of a blue whale weighs as much as a small car.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are still edible.
During the Victorian era, it was common to take photos of deceased loved ones (post-mortem photography).
The only part of the body that has no blood supply is the cornea of the eye.
Nintendo was founded in 1889, originally to produce handmade playing cards.
Octopuses have three hearts.
A cloud can weigh over a million pounds.
Istanbul is the only city in the world located on two continents (Europe and Asia).
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 to 45 minutes.
The world's most popular vegetable is the tomato, which is technically a fruit.
The average person walks the equivalent of five times around the Earth in a lifetime.
Baby kangaroos are called 'joeys'.
The name 'Lego' is derived from the Danish phrase 'leg godt', which means 'play well'.
Sound travels about 4.3 times faster in water than in air.
On Venus, a day is longer than a year.
The only mammal capable of sustained flight is the bat.
The Statue of Liberty was originally intended for Egypt.
The tongue is the only muscle in the human body that is attached at only one end.
In ancient Greece, carrots were originally purple, not orange.
A tarantula can survive for more than two years without food.
The color orange was named after the fruit, not the other way around.
The first computer mouse was invented in the 1960s and was made of wood.
Russia has a surface area larger than the planet Pluto.
Cows have 'best friends' and get stressed when separated from them.
The longest time between two people being awarded the Nobel Prize is 40 years.
Humans shed about 40 pounds of skin in a lifetime.
An elephant's pregnancy lasts for 22 months.
The smell of freshly cut grass is actually a plant distress call.
Ketchup was sold as a medicine in the 1830s.
There is a planet made of diamonds, about twice the size of Earth, called 55 Cancri e.
Butterflies taste with their feet.
The highest-grossing film of all time (unadjusted for inflation) is 'Avatar'.
The microwave oven was invented after a scientist walked past a radar tube and a chocolate bar melted in his pocket.
Your stomach acid is strong enough to dissolve razor blades.
A giraffe's neck is too short to reach the ground, so it must awkwardly spread its front legs to drink water.
One single strand of spaghetti is called a 'spaghetto'.
Mount Everest is not the tallest mountain. That title belongs to Mauna Kea in Hawaii, when measured from its base on the ocean floor.
Koalas have fingerprints almost indistinguishable from human ones.
Apples, peaches, and raspberries are all members of the rose family.
Footprints left on the Moon will remain there for 100 million years.
A group of crows is called a 'murder'.
The 'Save' icon on Microsoft Word (a floppy disk) is almost entirely obsolete.
The ancient Romans used human urine as mouthwash.
Your nose and ears continue to grow throughout your entire life.
The puffin's beak changes color during the year.
If you could fold a piece of paper 42 times, it would reach the Moon.
Pistachios are actually fruit, and they are related to the cashew.
A rhinoceros horn is made of keratin, the same protein that makes up human hair and fingernails.
California's state animal, the grizzly bear, has been extinct in California since 1924.
Mickey Mouse's original name was 'Mortimer Mouse'.
Polar bears are nearly undetectable by thermal cameras.
The Earth is not a perfect sphere; it's an oblate spheroid.
In ancient Egypt, pillows were often made of stone.
The average person forgets 90% of their dreams.
Ostrich eyes are bigger than their brains.
The most expensive spice in the world is saffron.
A 'jiffy' is an actual unit of time: 1/100th of a second.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped.
The inventor of the Pringles can, Fredric Baur, was cremated and had his ashes buried in a Pringles can.
If you were to drill a tunnel straight through the Earth and jump in, it would take you about 42 minutes to fall to the other side.
A group of owls is called a 'parliament'.
The Hawaiian alphabet has only 13 letters.
The national animal of Scotland is the unicorn.
More time travelers were registered in the 20th century than any other.
The world's largest rubber band ball weighs over 9,000 pounds.
A cockroach can live for several weeks without its head.
The first time the word 'OMG' was used in a letter was in 1917, written to Winston Churchill.
Tears, snot, and earwax all contain a type of antibody that works to fight off pathogens.
There is a species of jellyfish that is biologically immortal; it can revert to its juvenile stage.
The total weight of all the ants on Earth is estimated to be roughly the same as the total weight of all humans on Earth.
The longest place name in the world is Taumatawhakatangihangakoauauotamateaturipukakapikimaungahoronukupokaiwhenuakitanatahu in New Zealand.
The word 'typewriter' is the longest word that can be typed using only one row of the standard QWERTY keyboard.
The Earth is the only planet not named after a mythological god or goddess.
Sharks can live longer than 100 years.
The fear of long words is called 'hippopotomonstrosesquippedaliophobia'.
Dolphins sleep with one eye open.
The shortest sentence in the English language is 'I am'.
A bowling pin is called a 'pin' but it is technically a 'bottle'.
The smell of rain (petrichor) is caused by a bacteria called actinobacteria.
Humans share 50% of their DNA with bananas.
In Switzerland, it is illegal to own just one guinea pig, as they are social animals and need companionship.
The inventor of Vaseline ate a spoonful of it every day until he was 96.
There is a town in Norway called 'Hell' that freezes over in winter.
The average person spends six months of their life waiting for red lights to change.
The human brain generates about 12 to 25 watts of power—enough to light a low-wattage LED bulb.
Cows produce significantly more milk when they listen to classical music.
The strongest muscle in the human body is the jaw muscle (masseter).
The first object in space was a V-2 rocket carrying fruit flies.
The total energy released by a magnitude 8 earthquake is equivalent to the energy of about six million tons of TNT.
The original name for Monopoly's 'Marvin Gardens' was 'Marven Gardens', a misspelling that was never corrected.
The unicorn is the only mythical creature to be the national animal of a country (Scotland).
If you are having trouble sleeping, try repeatedly spelling out the word 'sassafras' in your head—it often works.
